snippet: The interest rate on many student loans is scheduled to double on July 1, to 6.8 percent from 3.4 percent, though even the current level is well above market.
abstract: Interest rate on many student loans is scheduled to double, to 6.8 percent from 3.4 percent, despite opposition and fact that current rate is well above market; student advocacy groups are releasing issue brief charging that federal government should not be profiting from student loans, while more and more students bear crushing debt.
lead_paragraph: The interest rate on many student loans is scheduled to double on July 1, to 6.8 percent from 3.4 percent, though even the current level is well above market.

headline.seo: Student Loan Rate Set to Rise, Despite Lack of Support
headline.main: Student Loan Rate Set to Rise, Despite Lack of Support
headline.print_headline: Loan Rate Set to Rise, Despite Lack Of Support
